title: MF ROTARY RAKES VS. WHEEL RAKES

tasks.task: Operating different types of rakes in a hayfield.
subtasks: Walking through a hayfield.
Locating thick hay and light hay areas.
Demonstrating the use of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake.
Showing the difference between a rotary rake and a V-Rake in windrow formation.
Adjusting a V-Rake to manage uneven windrows.
Comparing rotary rake versus V-Rake for hay drying and baling efficiency.
Noting the extra cost of a rotary rake and its potential returns.
Observing the effect of a rotary rake on windrow fluffiness and air flow.
Discussing crop pickup and windrow stability in different conditions.

tasks.task: Demonstrating the operation of farming equipment and its effects on hay.
subtasks: Using a Massey Ferguson rotary rake.
Operating a 12-foot wide Massey Ferguson rotary rake.
Using a 10-wheel V-Rake (10-foot width).
Demonstrating proper adjustment of the V-Rake for light crop areas.
Comparing windrow formation with rotary rake versus V-Rake.
Showcasing the drying process of hay in a rotary rake windrow.
Demonstrating baling with a small square baler using a rotary rake.
Measuring baling speed with a rotary rake versus V-Rake.
Discussing fuel savings with faster baling.

tasks.task: Presenting the benefits of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake.
subtasks: Highlighting the quality of hay produced with a rotary rake.
Emphasizing continued drying in the windrow.
Illustrating the ease of baling with a rotary rake.
Stressing the cost-effectiveness through improved hay quality and fuel savings.

tasks.task: Comparing the Massey Ferguson rotary rake to a V-Rake.
subtasks: Describing the differences in windrow appearance.
Explaining why the rotary rake is preferred for uneven crop conditions.
Demonstrating the Vsing of a V-Rake in thick hay.
Discussing the limitations of a V-Rake in longer crops.

tasks.task: Highlighting the value of the Massey Ferguson rotary rake.
subtasks: Demonstrating overall performance in various field conditions.
Reinforcing the benefits in terms of windrow uniformity and baling efficiency.
Advising viewers to consult local dealers for more information.

tasks.task: Demonstrating the use of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake compared to a V-Rake.
Compare the efficiency and use of a rotary rake versus a V-Rake in a hayfield.
Operate a Massey Ferguson rotary rake in a hayfield.
Operate a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and observe windrow formation.
Take notes on the demonstration of Massey Ferguson rakes.
Understand the benefits of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake over a V-Rake.
Demonstrate the use of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and compare it with a V-Rake.
Note the key differences between rotary rake and V-Rake in agricultural operations.
Operate a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and observe windrow formation.
subtasks: Walk through a hayfield in varying conditions (thick and light hay).
Demonstrate the use of the rotary rake in thick hay and observe windrow formation.
Demonstrate the use of a V-Rake in light hay and observe windrow formation.
Compare the windrows made by the rotary rake and V-Rake in terms of uniformity and fluffiness.
Use a square baler with both windrows and measure baling time.

tasks.task: Operate multiple rakes in a hayfield and measure their effectiveness.
subtasks: Drive the Massey Ferguson rotary rake through the thick hay, adjusting if necessary.
Drive the Massey Ferguson V-Rake through the light hay, adjusting if necessary.
Create windrows with both rakes and dismount to inspect.
Bale each windrow with a small square baler and time the process.

tasks.task: Demonstrate and compare the use of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and a V-Rake in a hayfield.
Demonstrate the use of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake compared to a V-Rake in a hayfield.
Compare the performance of a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and a V-Rake in a field.
Use a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and V-Rake in a hayfield and compare results.
Act as the demonstrator for a Massey Ferguson rotary rake.
Conduct a time trial comparing Massey Ferguson rotary rake versus V-Rake.

In conclusion, after considering the demonstration steps and the equipment in focus, the key physical tasks are related to handling the rakes and observing their effects. So the MAINTASK and subtasks would focus on operating the equipment and analyzing the results.
Operate a Massey Ferguson rotary rake and V-Rake in a hayfield.
subtasks: Walk through the field to evaluate varying crop density.
Demonstrate the Massey Ferguson rotary rake on thick hay, noting windrow formation.
Demonstrate the Massey Ferguson V-Rake on light hay, noting dual windrows.
Explain the necessity for adjusting the V-Rake in thin areas.
Compare windrow fluffiness and evenness between the two rakes.
Use a small square baler to demonstrate baling efficiency with each windrow.
Measure and note the time difference in baling speeds with the two rakes.
Discuss the continued drying process enabled by the rotary rake.
Consider the financial benefits of using a rotary rake over a V-Rake.
